conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D.
Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Stream A drops straight down without meeting any obstacle.
Stream B hits the pink baffle and is deflected to the left.
Stream C strikes the green slanted barrier and is deflected to the left.
Stream D flows along the white slanted barrier and turns right.

premise: Stream A drops straight down without meeting any obstacle.
conclusion: Most liquid from A ends in container E.

premise: Stream B hits the pink baffle and is deflected to the left.
conclusion: Little liquid from B ends in container E.

premise: Stream B and C merge, then encounter the blue baffle and are deflected to the right together.
conclusion: The other liquid from B and C reach container F.

premise: Stream D flows along the white slanted barrier and turns right.
conclusion: Liquid from D reaches container F.
